analyzed: vimāna vatthu  itthi vimāna  citta latā vagga
translated: The Mansion of the Thirty-Three🔽The Divine Maiden🔽The Cittalatā Mansion
The Divine Maiden of the Uposatha Day🔽“Divine one, you stand there
with surpassing beauty,
Shining in all directions,
like a medicinal herb, a star.
What is the cause of your beauty?

analyzed: vaṇṇaḥ ca te sabbadisā pabhāsati iti
translated: Your beauty shines in all directions.”
The deity, pleased,
is the result of that deed.
“They knew me as ‘Uposatha,’
a lay follower in Sāketa.
I was endowed with faith and virtue,
always delighting in sharing.
I gave clothing, food,
and lodgings with a lamp,
to those who were upright
with a serene mind.
On the fourteenth, fifteenth,
and eighth of the fortnight,

analyzed: pāṭihāriya pakkhañca  aṭṭhaṅga su samāgata  uposatham upavasissa
translated: and on the day of the full moon,🔽I observed the Uposatha with its eight factors.🔽Always restrained in the precepts,
I was controlled and shared.
I dwelt in a mansion
that was the result of that deed.
I refrained from killing living creatures
and was controlled in speech.
I was far from theft and sexual activity
and from drinking alcohol.
Delighting in the five training rules,
skilled in the noble truths,
a lay follower of the Buddha,
the famous Gotama.
Because of that I have such a complexion,

analyzed: vaṇṇaḥ ca me sabbadisā pabhāsati iti
translated: and my complexion shines in all directions.”
“Having heard the Nandana,
desire arose in me;
having directed my mind there,
I was reborn in the Nandana.
I did not do the Teacher’s bidding,
the Buddha, the Kinsman of the Sun;
having directed my mind to a lowly place,
I am one who later repents.”
“For how long in this mansion,
here on the day of the fast,
Goddess, tell me if you know,
how long your life will last.”
“Sixty thousand years,
and three hundred million years,
having stood here, great sage,
from here I will go
to be with human beings.”
“Do not be afraid on the day of the fast,
you have been declared by the Buddha
to be a stream-enterer, no longer subject to falling (to lower realms),
and your bad destinations have been destroyed.”
The Seventh Mansion Discourse on the Observance Days.
